description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6t3bb","text":"This protocol has been optimized for the recombinant expression of a codon-optizimed Pfu-Sso7d DNA polymerase. This is a fusion protein composed of the Pfu enzyme from Pyrococcus furiosus for DNA amplification by PCR fused to a small 7 kDa protein from Sulfobulus solfataricus that binds to double-stranded DNA without any preference for specific sequences, thus enhancing polymerization processivity without affecting the catalytic activity or thermal stability of the enzyme.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":253,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnaf7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3iqss","text":"The goal of this protocol was to eliminate the use of large volumes for dyalisis and potential issues with the protein crashing out of the solution due to the use of concentrators for buffer exchange of this enzyme into storage conditions. We also eliminated the use of DTT, which is often found in other similar protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qm5s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58nke","text":"The sequence plasmid encoding the codon-optimized Pfu-Sso7d enzyme used here can be found at https://benchling.com/s/seq-2TcUPjO2uMbDG5ufTQN4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":93,"length":48}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"59118C953E7F11EC9DCD0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://benchling.com/s/seq-2TcUPjO2uMbDG5ufTQN4"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu9lo","text":"On an ultracentrifugation tube, Incubate the unclarified lysate at   for   to precipitate most of E. coli proteins, and then place on ice for  . Centrifuge   and collect the supernatant. You might want to collect a small sample for SDS-PAGE afterwards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":98,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":142,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":156,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EDEDDFE0AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"48132","label":"","temperature":"70","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"F501DB10AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"78858","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"132FBA20AA9711EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"78859","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"20000","duration":1200,"guid":"25F358B0AA9711EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"116ec","text":"On a 1 mL HisTrap column preequilibrated with 10 column volumes (c.v.) (here, 10 mL) of Buffer A, load the supernant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faf7b","text":"Wash with 10-20 c.v. of Buffer A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n3fg","text":"Then, elute with 5 c.v. of Buffer B, collecting the eluted fractions every  in 1.5 ml tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.5","guid":"17CBBB00AA9811EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"87230","label":"","unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btf6l","text":"To quickly pool the fractions containing the protein of interest, prepare a 96-well plate or 1.5 mL tubes with  of Bradford reagent and  of distilled water. Then, add  of each protein fraction and compare against a blank reference sample corresponding to  of Buffer B. You can determine your protein-containing fractions either by absorbance at 595 nm on a plate reader or visually by comparing the blue coloration of each fraction against the blank reference. Pool your fractions and collect a   sample for SDS-PAGE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":259,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":136,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":167,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":255,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":495,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ee6lg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"40","guid":"002C4C10AA9A11EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"87231","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"03EBEC20AA9A11EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"87232","label":"","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"063F2AF0AA9A11EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"87233","label":"","unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"0CA496A0AA9A11EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"87234","label":"","unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"E3A9E0D0AA9D11EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"87235","label":"","unit":1}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"270v8","text":"This method was preferred over protein dyalisis or Amicon protein concentration to avoid using large buffer volumes and proteins crashing out of the solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5crq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oi7d","text":"Dilute the pooled fractions 3X in 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, such that the final concentration of NaCl is 100 mM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ukar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7uv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58eds","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8bsuv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fkvhf","text":"   ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6qv8n","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"2E475EE0AAA011EA9A2DF737733F2EAF","height":574,"id":184042,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ubv1","text":"The unlabelled lane corresponds to the PageRuler protein ladder. His = Pooled fraction from HisTrap IMAC column (20 µl), 1-2-3 correspond to eluted fractions from Heparin column (5 µl).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"protocolsio_1.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fvznbd4wx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fvzkbd4wx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fvzmbd4wx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fvzjbd4wx.webp","width":550},"mutability":"","type":"image"}}}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3422t","text":"Next, load the diluted sample onto a 1 ml HiTrap Heparin column previously equilibrated with 10 c.v. (here, 10 mL) of Buffer HA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17d74","text":"Then, elute the protein using a 10 c.v. linear gradient against Buffer HB, collecting the eluted fractions every   in 1.5 mL tubes. The protein will elute at high concentrations between 300 and 600 mM NaCl ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"61i48","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qef6","text":"This linear gradient can be achieved by connecting two containers, one with 5 c.v. Buffer HA and the other with 5 c.v. Buffer HB, with a syphon or a tube, and withdrawing solution from Buffer HA container to the column using a cheap peristaltic pump or by gravity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":119,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"C2DAE6D93E8011EC9DCD0A58A9FEAC02","id":"87236","label":"","unit":2}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4n1as","text":"Again, determine your protein-containing fractions using the Bradford assay. Pool your fractions and determine its protein concentration using the same method and collect a   sample for SDS-PAGE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"0BA411993E8111EC9DCD0A58A9FEAC02","id":"87237","label":"","unit":1}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9evoc","text":"For storage, supplement your pooled fraction with   Nonidet P-40 and   EDTA. Then, dilute the sample by adding glycerol up to    to reach final storage conditions: 25 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, ~250 mM NaCl, 0.1 mM EDTA, 0.1% Nonidet P-40, 50% glycerol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":164,"length":82}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":126,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.2","error_concentration":false,"guid":"446D57083E8111EC9DCD0A58A9FEAC02","id":"8537","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.2","guid":"446D54EF3E8111EC9DCD0A58A9FEAC02","id":"8538","label":"","unit":28}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"446D561C3E8111EC9DCD0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}
